subject: Re: [junit] *** Idea: Configurable Test Case ***
msgSnippet: ... You might want to take a look at JxUnit at http://sourceforge.net/projects/jxunit/ or http://quickutil.sourceforge.net/view/Main/JXUnit where it says:
messageBody:
At 10:58 PM 7/11/2001 +0000, gavinlas@... wrote:
>Hello,
>
>I have been looking at creating a configurable test suite and test
>cases.
>
>Snip...
>All comments, advice or suggestions are welcome.

You might want to take a look at JxUnit at
http://sourceforge.net/projects/jxunit/ or
http://quickutil.sourceforge.net/view/Main/JXUnit where it says:

JXUnit is a directory-driven test scripting which builds on JUnit and JXQuick.
Test data plays a central role in testing. From the lowest level (method
tests) to the highest (acceptance tests), a test involves input data,
expected output data, and a comparison between the expected and actual
output data.
JXUnit separates test data from test code. This has several advantages:
· Test data can be edited, making it easy to add additional test cases;
· Test data can be validated, as a means of reducing "false
failures"; and
· Test data can be externally generated or captured from a production
process.

Robert
